definition: to whisper to one another's ear
to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
suffix for nouns
to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb
ear/handle (archaeology)/and that is all (Classical Chinese)

sentences.english: With a quick look the teacher reproved the child for whispering in class.
sentences.chinese: 老師以極快的表情斥責在課堂上交頭接耳的同學。

sentences.english: People began to talk and laugh.
sentences.chinese: 人們開始交頭接耳並且鬨笑。
羣衆很興奮，嘁嘁喳喳交頭接耳。

sentences.english: And as soon as the old people said, "Poor Emily, " the whispering began.
sentences.chinese: 老人們一說到“可憐的愛米麗”，就會開始交頭接耳。

sentences.english: The spectators began to whisper again.

definition: lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
lit. the river that divides Chu and Han/fig. a line that divides rival territories/the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard
to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
a short time/a little while
to obstruct/to impede
daring/presumptuous/daredevil
to spike the ball (volleyball etc)/to smash (tennis etc)
to have no sense of shame/brazen
masthead (of a newspaper etc)/nameplate
doddering/senile
clever and eloquent (idiom); fluent/having the gift of the gab
keenly felt pain/bitter anguish
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: female gossip/busybody
see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
(not) a single person/(no) one
